intro: Cadia ellisiana, commonly known as the Ellis's cadia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
